page.title: 17Aycliffe Village History
page.content: 789 A.D.Saxon Synod re Danish Invasion 847 A.D.2nd.Synod of Aclea (Aycliffe) 1000 A.D.Danish invasion-houses fired. Canute grants Aycliffe to church. 1066 Richard de Mundeville became land owner in area after Norman Conquest. 1200 Thomas de Mundeville sold Aycliffe to the Bishopric. 1560 Eliz.I starts Church registers. 1570 Northern Rebellion-21 Aycliffe men caught and executed. 1606 James I accused Durham's Bishops of destroying Aycliffe's oak forest. 1642-44 Cromwell's men felled rest of forest oaks to mend road to Durham. 1780 John Wesley preached on green. 1830 Irish navvies on London/Edinburgh railway stayed in village and married 1897 Diamond Jubilee School built by villagers after row and besieging of C of E Head in school-police called. Now 4 schools in village.
